intro: Lindsaea diplosora, commonly known as the narrow-leaf lindsaea, is a member of the Bromeliaceae family and is native to tropical regions of South America. It is an epiphytic plant, meaning it grows on the surface of other plants without deriving nutrients from them. The plant features long, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its inflorescence consists of small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Lindsaea diplosora is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and ability to thrive in humid, shaded environments.
